website_summaries.verdict: While this 2-volume set covers a lot of web design areas, those who already have some knowledge here may not get a lot out of them.
pros: 2-book set includes "HTML & CSS: Designing and Building Web Sites" and "JavaScript & jQuery: Interactive Front-End Development."
Good, clear coverage of the basics
Helps you become proficient in HTML and CSS before moving on to more challenging topics
Well organized, and easy to read
cons: The bindings of these books are of poor quality
Some found the pace of these to be slow, and the illustrations and diagrams to be unhelpful

customer_reviews.title: GET THEM SPIRAL BOUND
customer_reviews.text: When I received them. I was excited to learn how to code. The problem was that every time I turn a page, it just felt like the book is about to break. After reading all the reviews about how their binding broke. I took action, I went to Staples and asked to get them spiral bind. They cost $6 each to add the spiral binding and I was impress with their results.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Tolome

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic place to start
customer_reviews.text: Even though this book came out in 2011, it's still incredibly useful (except for the chapter about flash). I got this a little over a week ago and I've completely finished the HTML/CSS book. Its very easy to understand, quick to read, and will get you on track to becoming a front end developer. I've attached a screenshot of a website I'm currently building. I went from 0 knowledge of web development to that in a week. The book continues to be useful after finishing it as a reference manual as well. While it doesn't cover absolutely everything, it's more than enough to get started.

customer_reviews.title: A very good complement to practical learning
customer_reviews.text: It is very good because it is easy to read and well organized. Some people would complain about a lot of images and empty spaces, but easy on the eyes for me and give you info in bites. The best way to use these books it to combine them with practical training (widely available online or on YouTube. Like SoloLearn and CodeAcademy). Read the relevant chapter in this book first, then practice it. Coding needs reading and practicing using various sources, because no single source gives you the whole story. It is a matter of accumulating bits and pieces of knowledge.

customer_reviews.title: Meant for absolute beginnings
customer_reviews.text: These two books are beautiful with their illustrations and such, but the pace at which they move is incredibly slow. As someone who has programming in other computer languages (C#, C++, C, Java) and other markup languages (XAML), I found it a bit irritating at time how the pacing of the book was. On that note, I wish some of the stock photography illustrations in the book were replaced with additional examples as the examples that were in the books were helpful. Nevertheless, the books are generally helpful, especially when laying out the format of functions and indicating what goes where. However, if you have programming experience elsewhere, consider another book.

customer_reviews.title: Still valuable almost 5 years in

I have found the content to be always accurate (rarely outdated, even in 2019) because these titles focus on baseline understanding and not peripheral topics. The design and color coding are both extremely attractive and I think the content is the right balance of words vs. sample HTML/CSS/JS code snippets. Highly recommended!

customer_reviews.text: This is a good starter book, but very dated. Grab a more modern book with css grids. An similar but updated book is the Visual CSS Dictonary. Search and buy it! I reach for that book first.
customer_reviews.author: Tuesday Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great content and design, less than ideal binding.
customer_reviews.text: The content and design if the books are great and very helpful. The only problem is the binding. I received the brand new books 1 week ago and when I tried to move one book across the table by putting my hand on the opened book and sliding it, the page ripped right out.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: A must have reference!
customer_reviews.text: These books are simple, yet very informative! Practice makes perfect, this is a great reference!
customer_reviews.author: Rafal D.

customer_reviews.title: Need an update
customer_reviews.text: This book is easy to understand. But it need an update. Plus, all the online materials mentioned in this book are expired.
customer_reviews.author: Thanh phung

customer_reviews.text: As many others have mentioned. These books do not hold up well. It's been a few years and I don't take these books out much. If I had, I'm sure I would have to replace them now... As for the content? The HTML/CSS book is GREAT for beginners and people who would like to refresh there skills. The Javascript & JQUERY...well......it's helpful but breaking down the syntax BUT, I was hoping for more creative website designs. Not how to build a website for your hotel.....
customer_reviews.author: suhvanuhrose

customer_reviews.title: Great for the basics
customer_reviews.text: While you can use the w3schools materials for free, these I have found have a better description for certain things. the hardback is good quality as well.
customer_reviews.author: BV

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners but just that
customer_reviews.text: These books are very basic and very flashy. If you want something that takes up a lot of space while only giving out the fundamental information in a pretty eye grabbing way these are good. If you are looking for something of more substance past what you can teach yourself in a few weeks these may not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: The books are really well written, easy to understand and a very nice place to start to learn HTML, CSS and JavaScript. Reading the other reviews I was ready to go and spiral bind ( I still might down the line) but actually having them in front of me and feeling them, I don’t feel the binding start to give or break apart so it’s not a huge concern to spiral bind them right away.
customer_reviews.author: B3kk@h

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: Everything I was looking for and more!!! Very well done, easy to read/understand and well illustrated. So grateful for this work. Absolutely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Ana A.

customer_reviews.title: Makes webdesign fun to learn. If you get distracted easily or have a short attention span, get this book.
customer_reviews.text: So far, this is my favorite basic client side web design book set. The information is delivered in an easy and somewhat fun way. It is difficult to lose focus with this book. Most important to me, the information is organized in such a way that it makes a pretty good reference book. It makes it easy to find specific syntax rules or properties that you might have forgotten because you have not used them in a while.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Fun and interesting coding
customer_reviews.text: These books are loaded with great details and informative explanations. There are pictures of the code that follow along with the book content. It helps to have some experience when reading the book. If you have little or no experience, then I would recommend starting with the HTML book first. Overall these are well-written books. Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Darian Welch

customer_reviews.title: Great books for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great combo book for beginners I would suggest to be specific what you are trying to get done before you purchase your book.
customer_reviews.author: GamingPod

customer_reviews.title: Top of the class presentation (packaging) of the subject
customer_reviews.text: The best book in its series. Why? Stimulating visuals which keeps me going. I covered more grounds in learning Javascript compared to self learning using other JS books.
customer_reviews.author: Bud

customer_reviews.title: Solid reference
customer_reviews.text: Simple and effective. Just what I was looking for. You can search online and find a thousand solutions to anything or you can get a good solid unchanging reference (my preference) that way your code stays clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jp

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Resource
customer_reviews.text: The author doesn't waste time explaining anything, he gets right to the point. These books helped me get my foot in the door with Javascript. I had previously known HTML and CSS but I thought I'd buy the book anyway and hope I'd learn some new tricks, which I did. The layout of the book is wonderful and it is overall just a really good resource for a beginner, or even a more experienced developer.
customer_reviews.author: RyanEffects

customer_reviews.title: Great books!
customer_reviews.text: Love the colored pictures and detail. Very easy to read and well designed. Great for anyone wanting to learn or study Web design.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great book for beginner web designers
customer_reviews.text: Great book for beginner web designers. Formal Introduction to vanilla Javascript and Jquery ..and as well as HTML5 and CSS3.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Really well designed and easy to follow! I really enjoy how the chapters are broken down.
customer_reviews.author: james hunt

customer_reviews.title: A Great Intro to Web Design/Dev
customer_reviews.text: The pair is a great introduction to front end web design and development. The only complaint I have is the focus on fallback JavaScript code for use in older browsers that are hardly used today, which can also be fixed with jQuery. Not a big deal but I did not find this part relevant. Overall great books to start with.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Boncella

customer_reviews.title: A great buy at a freat price.
customer_reviews.text: So far these books have been used more for references to look up stuff as I don't always like to check random Google searches for answers and it's helped me out a lot. The topics covered are done in an easy to understand format with good relevant examples and images. The books look good enough to also go in my shelf and not stick out in a negative way like my for dummies books.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Lantigua

customer_reviews.title: Fun book, but plenty of typos
customer_reviews.text: By far the most engaging computer science/programming book I've come across. Love the quality of the pages and how they're colorful and the funny example codes, however, there are quite a lot of typos.
customer_reviews.author: Eren

customer_reviews.title: Well written begginers book
customer_reviews.text: These are very well written books and I didn’t find any binding issues with the hard copy. They assume you know nothing about coding and explain everything in detail. Everything is well organized and attracts the eye as well. And it’s easy to read through.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I loved these books
customer_reviews.text: I loved these books! I read them from cover to cover. Being new to HTML, CSS, JavaScript and JQuery, these books were perfect for learning the basics and made getting started so much easier. Easy reading, great graphics, and real examples made these books invaluable in my new position. Two thumbs up to Jon Duckett.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal! I was able to construct a html/css website without any issue with training clean and clear information. Easy to learn. And most importantly a great path into a new career

customer_reviews.title: Great Books
customer_reviews.text: It is a must to have them handy. Well written and you have plenty of information there.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Herbut

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 WOULD RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. Highly recommend. The pictures supplement what you're learning to make it fun and easy. And what better way to learn than through fun and facts!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great book for beginner coders.
customer_reviews.text: These books are super helpful to anyone who needs a visual example. I wish this author collaborated with other computer languages to write books on those. I reference these often due to their organization and examples. Great book for beginner coders.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Campbell

customer_reviews.title: It's beautifully laid out and very helpful
customer_reviews.text: These books are helping me a ton! It's beautifully laid out and very helpful. The only complaint is that the books don't stay open and so I need to order a book opener or some kind of paper weight. Otherwise the information in these books are right on.

customer_reviews.title: POOR PRINTING
customer_reviews.text: Whenever i encounter a black background page (which is a good chunk of the book) the ink comes off the page and gets on my fingers and makes a mess.....HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED...

customer_reviews.title: A Perfect Match
customer_reviews.text: Used as texts for a Coursera Course. Superbly written with clear and common sense instructions. Many useful pictures for step-by-step progress to successful completion. Highly recommended for beginner or intermediate HTML, CSS and JavaScript/JQuery students and developers.

customer_reviews.text: had to rebuy after giving my copies out to someone starting out. Always my highest recommended to visual learners and I love them for reference for the same reason.
